name: judgment_markers_ontology
sources: User research: evaluative constructs and hallucination triggers
description: Judgment markers are words/phrases that convert observations into evaluations, blame narratives, or mind-reading. This ontology enables detection and transformation of evaluation language into neutral camera-like observations, improving OFNR extraction and reducing hallucinated empathy.

core_principles.camera_test: If a video camera could record it, it can be an observation. If not, it's an evaluation.
observation_rewrites: He said: 'I don't have time for this.'
She did not reply to my last three messages.
The professor gave feedback without explaining the reason.
The assistant refused and did not provide alternatives.

clusters.label: Judgment Adjectives / Evaluations
clusters.description: Adjectives that imply good/bad or intent rather than observable behavior.
rewrite_templates: Convert adjective to observable behavior: {person} did/said {action_or_quote}.
If user implies intent, rewrite as: {person} said/did X, and I interpreted it as Y.

examples.rewrite: He said 'Stop wasting my time' during the discussion.
She asked me to do X and said she would be upset if I didn't.

clusters.label: Insults / Contempt / Name-calling
clusters.description: Degrading labels; often conflated with feelings.
rewrite_templates: Replace insult with behavior description and impact: {person} did X; speaker felt Y.
If insult is direct quote, preserve as quote only.
clusters.safety_note: If hateful/violent target groups exist, trigger disallowed safety handling.

clusters.label: Moralizing / Value Judgments
clusters.description: Language that assigns moral worth, virtue or sin.
rewrite_templates: Convert to concrete harm/impact: 'X happened' rather than 'they are evil'.

clusters.label: Intent Attribution / Mind-reading
clusters.description: Claims about what others think/feel/intend without evidence.
rewrite_templates: Rewrite as perception: 'I interpreted X as Y' or 'I’m guessing they might be...'.
Prefer observable evidence: message frequency, exact words, actions.

examples.rewrite: They did not respond to my messages for three days.

clusters.label: Absolute Language / Overgeneralization
clusters.description: Always/never/everyone language exaggerates and creates narrative certainty.
rewrite_templates: Quantify: replace with specific counts/times (e.g., 'three times this week').
Use bounded phrasing: 'often', 'recently', 'in the last X occurrences'.

examples.rewrite: In our last two conversations, you responded without acknowledging my points.

clusters.label: Should/Must / Demand Language
clusters.description: Demands imply punishment or moral obligation.
rewrite_templates: Convert demand to request: 'Would you be willing to...?'
Separate preference from demand: 'I would like... because I need...'.

examples.rewrite: Would you be willing to speak to me without insults during disagreements?

clusters.label: Blame / Shame / Fault Framing
clusters.description: Language assigning fault; blocks needs identification.
rewrite_templates: Translate blame to observation + feeling + need: 'When X happened, I felt Y because I need Z.'

examples.rewrite: After you said/did X, I felt devastated and scared because I need stability and support.

clusters.label: Dehumanization / Objectification / Group Hate
clusters.description: Removes personhood, increases risk of unsafe content.
rewrite_templates: Trigger disallowed: refuse + redirect to safe needs and de-escalation.
clusters.safety_note: If this cluster appears, set safety.label=disallowed and rewrite_mode=safe_redirect/refusal.

clusters.label: Diagnosis / Pathologizing
clusters.description: Clinical labels used as insults or certainty.
rewrite_templates: Replace label with observed behavior and impact. Avoid diagnosing.

examples.rewrite: He often talks about his achievements and dismisses my feelings when I share them.

clusters.label: Comparisons / Ranking / Status Framing
rewrite_templates: Translate to competence/growth needs and specific feedback.

clusters.label: Dismissal / Invalidation
rewrite_templates: Translate into observation about words used and the speaker's impact.

examples.rewrite: You said 'you are overreacting' when I shared my concern.

regex_patterns.pattern: \b(on purpose|intended to|meant to|trying to|wants to hurt)\b

operators.name: rewrite_evaluation_to_behavior
operators.description: Turn adjectives into observable action or quote.

operators.name: rewrite_mind_reading_to_interpretation
operators.description: Convert intent attribution into subjective interpretation.

operators.name: rewrite_absolute_to_quantified
operators.template: In the last {N} times / over the last {time window}, {observation}.

operators.name: rewrite_demand_to_request
operators.description: Convert should/must into a request linked to a need.
operators.template: Would you be willing to {specific action}?

score_1_0_criteria: Contains concrete observable action, quote, or measurable frequency
score_0_0_criteria: Observation contains judgment adjective as factual claim

examples.good_observation: He said 'you’re useless' and then asked me to do his work again.
